definition: spoof (web-based genre in PRC, acquiring cult status from 2005, involving humorous, satirical or fantastical videos, photo collections, texts, poems etc)
to do/to make/to go in for/to set up/to get hold of/to take care of
spoofing culture (Web-based genre in PRC acquiring cult status from 2005, involving humorous, satirical or fantastical videos, photo collections, texts, poems etc)

sentences.english: The film is a parody of the novel The Legend of the Condor Heroes by Louis Cha.
sentences.chinese: 該片是金庸武俠小說《射鵰英雄傳》的惡搞版。

sentences.english: The Razzies also had fun with this year's Oscar-nominated films.
sentences.chinese: 金酸莓獎還惡搞了今年的奧斯卡提名影片。

sentences.english: Quoteing all the music is just for fun, I mean no malicious and thanks to original author.
sentences.chinese: 引用各音樂純粹蛋疼惡搞無惡意感謝各原作者。

sentences.english: Sometimes you can mess with the computer, for better or for worse.
sentences.chinese: 其實你也可以惡搞一下電腦，好也罷壞也罷，都行。

sentences.english: What? It sounds funny. Mischievous distortion is on its way.
sentences.chinese: 什麼？很有意思啊。現在，惡搞是大行其道啊。

sentences.english: Kuso is a popular Internet culture at present.
sentences.chinese: 惡搞是當前十分流行的網絡文化。

sentences.english: So you are enjoying the Kuso activity?
sentences.chinese: 你很愛這個惡搞的活動了？

sentences.english: The juggled culture is a kind of mass culture supported by the network popularly.
sentences.chinese: 惡搞是藉助網絡流行起來的一種大衆文化。

sentences.english: Well, what about something wickedly funny and totally offbeat?
sentences.chinese: 來點古怪而又惡搞的東西怎麼樣？

sentences.english: I like a good spoof movie.
We thought it was just some type of new tagger .
sentences.chinese: 起初我們還當它是一種新式惡搞。

sentences.english: Other than the above ideas, I have also considered making movie goofs .
sentences.chinese: 除了自創的橋段外，還可以玩電影惡搞。

sentences.english: It turns out, Anti-SocialNetworking sites are spoofs of popular online communities.
sentences.chinese: 現在看來，反社會化網絡是對當下流行網站的惡搞。

sentences.english: Apparents is the low key scientific experiment, actually initiated the numerous net friends to do wickedly .
sentences.chinese: 貌似是很低調的科學實驗，卻引發了衆網友的惡搞。

sentences.english: Ugly people into beauties P, it is the most ironic.
sentences.chinese: 醜人被P成美人，簡直就是最諷刺的惡搞。

sentences.english: On top of all that, a koala once tried to do me a very nasty mischief.
sentences.chinese: 最可惡的是，我曾經被一隻樹熊惡搞了一場。

definition: silly talk or "mo lei tau" (Cantonese), genre of humor emerging from Hong Kong late in the 20th century
to sign (one's name with a pen etc)/to autograph/signature
to plagiarize/to copy/to attack the flank or rear of an enemy
